item.caption: Sarah Jane Cantrell, NP - 01/30/2025 2:00 PM EST

content.content:
Formatting of this note is different from the original.
Images from the original note were not included.
Transitional Care Management Face-to-Face Visit
Hospital Follow-up
Subjective
Date of Admission: [1/23/25]
Date of Discharge: 1/23/25 2:31 PM
Date of TCM Call: 8/20/2021
Chief Complaint
Patient presents with
Hospital Follow-up
HPI
Roger presents today after recent hospitalization for Peptic ulcer disease
:
Transitional Care Management - 01/30/25 1416
Transitional Care Management - Post Discharge Questions
Hospital Diagnosis Peptic ulcer disease
Post-discharge Medication Reconciliation performed? YES
How is your condition since your discharge? Same
Are you receiving in home care from home health or physical therapy? No, however I'm not in need of any support.
Are you receiving appropriate care/assistance at home? Yes
Are you in need of any equipment that would make your daily activities easier? Yes
Have you been to any other doctors appointments since you have been discharged from the hospital? No
Follow up Appointments:
Future Appointments
Date Time Provider Department Center
3/24/2025 10:30 AM Alison Renner, DO MGCFMBS BSM
Review of Systems
Constitutional: Positive for activity change.
Gastrointestinal: Positive for abdominal pain.
Musculoskeletal: Positive for back pain.
Objective
Visit Vitals
BP (!) 150/78 (BP Cuff Site Location: Right arm, Patient Position: Sitting, BP Cuff Size : Regular)
Pulse 80
Temp 98.5 F (36.9 C) (Tympanic)
Resp 20
Ht 5' 4" (1.626 m)
Wt 66.8 kg (147 lb 6 oz)
SpO2 100%
BMI 25.30 kg/m
Physical Exam
Constitutional:
Appearance: Normal appearance. He is well-developed.
Cardiovascular:
Rate and Rhythm: Normal rate and regular rhythm.
Abdominal:
General: Bowel sounds are normal. There is no distension.
Palpations: Abdomen is soft.
Tenderness: There is no abdominal tenderness.
Musculoskeletal:
General: Normal range of motion.
Cervical back: Neck supple.
Lumbar back: Spasms present.
Skin:
General: Skin is warm.
Capillary Refill: Capillary refill takes less than 2 seconds.
Neurological:
General: No focal deficit present.
Mental Status: He is alert and oriented to person, place, and time.
Psychiatric:
Mood and Affect: Mood is depressed. Affect is tearful.
Behavior: Behavior is withdrawn.
Pulmonary:
Effort: Pulmonary effort is normal.
Breath sounds: Normal breath sounds.
Vitals and nursing note reviewed.
Assessment/Plan
Assessment & Plan
PUD (peptic ulcer disease)
Orders:
pantoprazole (use for PROTONIX) 40 mg EC tablet; Take 1 tablet (40 mg total) by mouth in the morning and 1 tablet (40 mg total) in the evening. Take before meals.
Comprehensive Metabolic Panel Without Modified Cockcroft-Gault CRCL
CBC auto differential
Urinalysis
Uncontrolled hypertension
Patient's blood pressure is not currently at goal.
Today, medications were changed in the following manner : refills sent in today.
Stressed the need for increased control.
Lab work was reviewed and updated as needed.
Discussed the role of diet, exercise, control of stress, and reduced salt intake in lowering blood pressure numbers.
Discussed referral to Nephrology.
Patient will be re-evaluated in 3 months or earlier if needed.
Orders:
losartan (use for COZAAR) 50 mg tablet; Take 1 tablet (50 mg total) by mouth in the morning and 1 tablet (50 mg total) in the evening.
Lipid panel
Current severe episode of major depressive disorder without psychotic features, unspecified whether recurrent (CMS/HCC)
Patient's depression is not currently under control.
Noted that the patient is not suicidal, and contracted with me today for safety in the case that suicidality arises.
Medications were adjusted in this manner : restart medications.
Discussed the role of counseling and avoidance of stress factors that can be controlled.
We will re-evaluate shortly.
Reinforced concepts of healthy diets, consistent exercise, and compliance with medications to ensure favorable results.
Orders:
FLUoxetine (use for PROzac) 10 mg capsule; Take 1 capsule (10 mg total) by mouth in the morning.
Type 2 diabetes mellitus with hyperglycemia, without long-term current use of insulin (CMS/HCC)
Labs pending
Orders:
Hemoglobin A1c
Comprehensive Metabolic Panel Without Modified Cockcroft-Gault CRCL
CBC auto differential
Urinalysis
BMI 25.0-25.9,adult
Body mass index is 25.3 kg/m.
Nutrition counseling for illness/PUD
Plan of Care:
Patient agrees to take all medications as directed
Patient is here for a transition of care visit.
I have reviewed the TCM summary as noted on the form.
Discussed her hospitalization and plan of care. All pertinent xrays, lab works, and notes as available were reviewed at the time of this visit.
The discharge medication list and the outpatient medication list have been reconciled and reviewed. Any changes are reflected in the updated medication list provided to the patient in the After Visit Summary.
Diagnostic testing performed in the hospital was reviewed.
The discharge summary or last progress note from the above listed hospitalization was reviewed.
Electronically signed by Sarah Jane Cantrell, NP at 01/30/2025 4:17 PM EST

content.content:
Formatting of this note might be different from the original.
Please call patient and let him know that his kidney function is still a concern and his Hgb has dropped, make sure he is taking his iron medication twice a day.
Also make sure to follow up with GI- should of already called to schedule an apt along with his Nephrologist.
